projects.title: Gamba Gun
projects.description: A currently unreleased action roguelike game developed by 'Nolamo Softworks'. As of writting, my role has largely been in refactoring & development of supporting gameplay systems.

projects.title: California V2
projects.description: A vastly overhauled update for the 2019 'California' map for Unturned. The project had 6 years of development time with 5-6 active developers at any given time from many countries. This update featured a vastly overhauled and expanded map, gameplay loop and greatly increased visual fidelity.

projects.title: Wang Slime
projects.description: A slime mold simulation combined with wang tiles. Slime agents navigate a simple procedurally generated map which can be updated at runtime. This is possible as the simulation is entirely ran on the GPU.

projects.title: Sistor Fixor
projects.description: A prototype for a Digital Logic Sim puzzle game. Developed in 2 days. The focus of the game is more on problem solving than real-world accuracy.

projects.title: Rio de Janeiro Remastered
projects.description: Remake of the 2019 curated map, with greatly improved gameplay and visuals. My work was largely focused on optimisation, and assisting with direction, playtesting and ideation.

projects.title: StrongBadZone
projects.description: A recreation of StrongBadZone from Homestar Runner, Strong Bad Email #94. This was programmed in TypeScript using the Phaser 3 framework, and was my final project for CMPM 120 @ UCSC, Winter '25. The majority of art assets are 3D wireframe models.

projects.title: Fly-By
projects.description: A midterm project for CMPM 120 & UCSC, Winter '25. Fly-By is an Endless Runner where you pilot a paper airplane, weaving through an ever increasing volley of obstacles. This game used a custom physics routine modeled after Minecraft's Elytra physics.

projects.title: Spebby's Chess Engine
projects.description: A basic Chess Engine & AI programmed in C++ using Dear ImGui as a graphical front-end. The engine makes use of bitboards and negamax for its inbuilt AI, and can play to depth 5 in near realtime.

projects.title: Back to the Frog
projects.description: Final project for an introductory game desgin & programming class & UCSC, made part-time in 3 weeks. This was my first foray into the Godot engine after a nearly 2 year long break from working on game programming. I wrote the entire games codebase, and did most of the level design, though that was not my main focus.

projects.title: Booliards
projects.description: A fast-paced retro-styled arcadey billiards action game with classic charm. I worked on game design, wave design, achievements, Newgrounds integration and backend architecture.

projects.title: Egg Rush
projects.description: A cracking beat-em-up staring a rotten egg, created as a submission for the Newgrounds July Jam 2021. Developed in 3 days! I worked on core gameplay systems, upgrades and enemy behaviour.

projects.title: Tower of Towers
projects.description: A charming 16-bit platformer, and winnter of 'Best Technical Quality' in Andr√© Young's 'Game Jaaj 5'. Development was ~2 weeks for the initial release. I worked on level design and implementation of side content like collectables and niche hazards. For the Newgrounds release, I handled Newgrounds integration, localisation and overhauled several levels.

projects.title: Easter Island
projects.description: In development for a little under a year, Easter Island is an officially endorsed 'curated' modding project for the hit indie game Unturned. It was featured in-game in Feburary 2020, and remains permently accessible (though no longer preinstaled). Work on this project was primairly level-design, game balancing, project & team management and 3D art based.

projects.title: Rio de Janeiro
projects.description: The original 2019 release of the curated unturned map. I assisted with development and became more involved towards the end of development, helping to push the map, which had been in development for years, across the finish line. Post-release I helped to support it with bug fixes, community support and optimisations.

projects.title: Christmas In July
projects.description: A christmas-themed entry to the community-hosted '2019 Summer MapJam'. Development was just under a month and intended to be played as a deathmatch map.

projects.title: Freighter
projects.description: Second place winner of the community-hosted 'MapJam June 2019'. Development was 2 weeks, and was the first major project I worked on that released.
